comment.body: Yay! I can see it!! LOL. I also used my other machine to visit too so you have two more peers. Have a great day :)

> [jamesholden](#comment_5_12w3zJ6gRrcAw2kSCQXDkorgqxuXnkKkF8): Awesome, thanks ! I just saw you had a blog on your own, I'll read & seed as well :)

Awesome! Thanks bro :)

I have a question that maybe you can help with. I want to clone a GitCenter repo. I am using Windows 10 with Git installed. Do I simply just go into Git CMD and run the git clone command with the ZeroNet data directory like it says?

> [jamesholden](#comment_6_12w3zJ6gRrcAw2kSCQXDkorgqxuXnkKkF8): I guess if you click on the "clone" button there http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/?1NaRTgwxsn17BCVSfvq6LG8NVPb9srKG5X you'll be able to clone the repo properly. But in fact, I'm not really familiar with Gitcenter on ZN which is a bit different from the usual Git servers I'm used to. Maybe @Gitcenter on ZeroMe can help ?
> In any case, if you want the code, I can zip it and share it with you, just let me know :)

Hey James. Thanks for taking the time to answer. I got it figured out ;)
